protected  void setCoefficients(double[] coefficients)
          Sets the coefficients of the autoregressive process Throws a NullPointerException if coefficients has not be allocated WARNING: No checking for valid coefficient values is performed The coefficients are copied for use in the class
 void setControls(Controls controls)
          Takes in a valid instance of Controls for this class If controls is null or if it was not created by this class this method should throw an IllegalArgumentException
 void setHistory(double[] history)
          Sets the history of the AR process Throws IllegalArgumentException if history.length does not equal coefficients.length The convention is that history[0] is the most recent value and thus history[history.length-1] is the oldest value the array history is copied for use has the history of the process

Constructs AutoRegressiveNormal given the array of parameter coefficients Throws a NullPointerException if coefficients has not be allocated WARNING: No checking for valid coefficient values is performed

coefficients - an array of the coefficients for the AR process

setCoefficients

protected final void setCoefficients(double[] coefficients)
Sets the coefficients of the autoregressive process Throws a NullPointerException if coefficients has not be allocated WARNING: No checking for valid coefficient values is performed The coefficients are copied for use in the class

Parameters:
coefficients - an array of the coefficients for the AR process

setHistory

public final void setHistory(double[] history)
Sets the history of the AR process Throws IllegalArgumentException if history.length does not equal coefficients.length The convention is that history[0] is the most recent value and thus history[history.length-1] is the oldest value the array history is copied for use has the history of the process

Parameters:
history - an array containing the history of the process

initializeHistory

public final void initializeHistory()
Initialize the history of the AR process, by filling it with randomly generated values N(0,1) Obviously, these are iid and cause some initialization bias

setParameters

public final void setParameters(double[] parameters)
Sets the mean, variance of the process parameters[0] = mean parameters[1] = variance

resetStartStream

public final void resetStartStream()
Description copied from interface: RandomStreamIfc
The resetStartStream method will position the RNG at the beginning of its stream. This is the same location in the stream as assigned when the RNG was created and initialized.

Specified by:
resetStartStream in interface RandomStreamIfc
